intro: Deinocheilos jiangxiense, commonly known as the Jiangxi spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its striking, yellow-orange cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
